Posts.Content: Hi PGtips I too had the LDFlap with implant and am pleased with the results, I am having my other boob reduced to match, at the moment I have one C cup and one E cup. What persuaded me was the quicker recovery time and no stomach weakness, so I could get onto chemo and get this nightmare over quicker. Must say though I have heard you get a more natural result and a tummy tuck thown in, so maybe the extra recovery could be worth it for you, hopefully someone who has had the diep flap will post as well. Good luck
Posts.Title: reconstruction diep, tram or ld

Posts.Content: Hi I went through a slightly similar scenario when the nurse at my first chemo said I was triple negative and it was only when I saw the Oncologist at my last appointment and she was talking about Tamoxifen that found I was ER+ I guess everyone is human and I had asked the nurse to read my notes.
Posts.Title: Wrong cancer entered on my file

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies There is always the other side in this, what sort of women would have an affair with a man whose wife is battling cancer? I shouldnt be shocked really as my mum used to work with a woman who was sent to help a disabled lady with 6 children and promptly ran off with her husband! I myself was dumped or should I say ignored after I was diagnosed so maybe my judgement is clouded on this one. Good luck to everyone, I found my friends were fabulous.
Posts.Title: Unfaithful husband

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies   On a lighter note. I am ten days post FEC chemo and getting cravings like I was pregnant. Fish of any description, canned or fresh and tomato juice, Am I normal! Still got hair, just waiting for that to go as well.
Posts.Title: Cravings

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies BTW that is for initial biopsy, if you have a sentinel node biopsy it takes several days as results have to be double checked by several technicians as its a more complex test and its so crucial to know for treatment plans.
Posts.Title: still waitin

Posts.Content: Hi Foxyferret Love the name BTW.  I had my biopsy on a Monday and was given the results the following Monday. Couldn't ask my friend as I knew she wouldn't be able tell me anyway, would get the sack if anyone found out.  Still I was convinced it wasn't c anyway just a cyst, laughable now.   Anyway my friend has told me it annoys her sometimes as breast cancer is always top priority and takes preference over other types of c.  Apparantley its goverment policy so must be the same at all NHS hospitals too.  I think its an easy get out to always blame the lab for delays when it is more likely that consultant is away, clinic full etc. Lets just hope no news is good news.
Posts.Title: still waitin

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies Just wanted to share some info with you.  I have a very good friend who works in path lab at local hospital and she says that all breast biopsies are always analysed the day they go down to the lab even if its late afternoon they stay and finish them.  The delay is always the consultant /clinic who inevitably blame the lab for being slow. Get on the phone and give them hell, its the waiting that is the worse. Hoping its good news! Rosie
Posts.Title: still waitin

Posts.Content: Hi Shawshank Just a thought here, maybe its good news thats why they are in no rush to see you.  Still not acceptable anyway they might know, but you who are the most important person here do not. I must say my experience was totally the opposite, biopsy Monday, results next Monday.  Called BCN later that afternoon, went into see here to discuss surgery options next day and she fitted me in with consultant that Thursday.  So had a plan within days. I would be tempted to get results and see about transfering hospitals if thats an option as surely if consultant was no appointment their registrar could see you or even BCN.
Posts.Title: still waitin

Posts.Content: Yes I can't believe I am saying this but am nearly ready for the first colouring.  I bought the L'Oreal mousse absolute as you can reuse it, but was then told by my hairdresser its not a good choice as it contains ammonia. Has anyone used one of those root touch ups?  I think its just me being tight but I hate to throw 3/4 of the dye away! Thanks X
Posts.Title: Hair dye

Posts.Content: Hi I spent ages last weekend looking for the cheapest travel insurance and found a company called oktotravel was the cheapest.  They quoted £38.00 for 5 days in Dubai (without declaring the dreaded C it would have been £8.00). Hope this helps.
Posts.Title: TRAVEL INSURANCE

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies   I had an mx and LD flap reconstruction ten days ago and the last few days have dressed to go out.  I have found my rib cage seems swollen and sore (not surprised about that).  But I can't wait to come home and remove my bra is this normal?  Am I expecting too much, too soon?   BTW it is a very comfy m&s post surgery bra and I am using bra extenders.
Posts.Title: Uncomfortable Bra after LD Flap Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Lindy Welcome, as other ladies have said its the club no one wants to join, but I have found the support on here amazing, there is always someone out there to help. I have a lovely lady surgeon too and as you said you were in the north west was wondering if its the same one?  I have sent a friend request so you can send me a private message if you like. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Hello, I'm a newbie

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies Mine started to grow back after 2nd Tax, previously had 3 FEC.  Just finished third and final Tax chemo on Monday and its about 1/2 inch but baby fine like down.  Think it will be many months before I can boost an Annie Lennox type style.
Posts.Title: when does your hair come back

Posts.Content: Hi Sasha I just wish I could say something to help you as you have helped so many other people in the past.  I feel sure you are a lovely person and you will get a new boob you are happy with at some time in the future. I was lucky to have immediate reconstruction and to be able to wear my old clothes, tatty old things that they are, did really help to feel my old self again. Sending you all my best wishes
Posts.Title: Does it stay llike this?

Posts.Content: Hi Sandra Firstly thanks you for posting your experience on here, I am so sorry your nipple went wrong.  I am looking ahead and thinking about nipple reconstruction myself, but in all honesty the 2 ladies I know who have both had them done say don't bother as even the best ones flatten out after time. I am hoping lots of ladies will come on here now and give the positive side of this! Good luck to everyone
Posts.Title: nipple reconstruction failure

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I guess we all have similar stories to tell.  My so called partner (didn't live with so maybe boyfriend is more apt)  started making excuses to not come and see me like my daughters friends sons friend, you get the picture, has got a cold so I might get one in a few days and I don't want to pass it onto you. He starts avoiding me a few weeks before christmas when we had a big christmas ball booked and he knew I was so looking forward to it after finishing chemo.  Would it have killed him to have come with me and wait until after christmas, after 4 years together!   BTW my daughter came with me in the end and we had a brilliant time. Sorry needed to get that off my chest, no pun intended.
Posts.Title: How to deal with how people react

Posts.Content: Hi Saw an article in the Daily Mail today regarding the above shampoo.  One lady claimed it had growth 2 inches in under 4 weeks, she was a recent chemo patient. Just wondered if anyone had tried it?  As at £24.99 it is a bit pricey, but would be happy to pay that for a decent bit of growth post chemo. Best wishes to all
Posts.Title: Nisim Fast Shampoo

Posts.Content: Hi Aroma mum Hi and welcome to the group.I have mx and reconstruction last June, had 6 checmos finished end October and when I went to see the surgeon regarding reducing the good boob to even things up she suggested waiting several months to allow the effects of the chemo to go. This could be because its more of a cosmetic job through so they may want to operate sooner on you. I am sure there will be others who have been in the same situation and who can help. Good luck
Posts.Title: New to the group

Posts.Content: Hi Greville This is one of my pet subjects as I have a very good friend who works in a path lab.  She always tells me they have strict guidelines about timing so if you were told initially it would be 2 weeks then it would be. She says 99% of the time they can't fit in a clinic appointment or there is no doctor available and its any easy thing to blame the faceless people in the lab. That said you probably don't have much choice but to wait it out and we all know how hard that is! Fingers crossed the results are good. X
Posts.Title: delay to pathology reports

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies   Never thought I would say this but I am wishing I had a job in the public sector with sick pay.  I had 3 weeks off using my holidays to have mx and LD Flap reconstruction.  Since going back to work last week I have worked non stop every day to try and catch up and am panicing now I won't be up to date by the time I start chemo on Monday in case I need a few days off to recover.  Finding it a struggle and the house is a total tip as I can't find any energy to clean up after working a full day. Have no choice but to keep working as I am a single mum with a mortgage.   Sorry I know lots of people are worse off than me, just needed to sound off, normally such an upbeat person, being tired has turned me into a grumpy old woman!
Posts.Title: Will I be able to work through treatment?

Posts.Content: Thanks Tinkers and Sue Thats what is so brilliant about this forum, we all understand as we are all going through the same thing.  I say things on here I can't say to friends as they wouldn't understand.  They would just say give up the job, but were would that leave me afterwards trying to get a job at 52, just finished treatment for cancer, I imagine years on the dole.   Best wishes to everyone X
Posts.Title: Will I be able to work through treatment?

Posts.Content: Hi Girls Just when I thought I had got off lightly the dreaded tax kicks in, hot sweats, nerve pain barely controlled by Ibuprofen and white furry mouth and can't taste anything.  Realize now I should have asked for heavier duty painkillers but unable to move and its the weekend so any advice much appreciated.  How long does it go on for?  Had Tax last  Monday, started pains Wednesday? Thanks for any help
Posts.Title: Docetaxol You B*****D !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I too was a larger lady 38E with a size 10 bottom half and all my life have attracted the wrong sort of attention from men.  When I realized that I could have my new boob any size I wanted (in my case C cup) I am going to have my good boob reduced to match.  I think of this as my silver lining for all this crap, finally getting the boob size I have always wanted but could never afford. This is just my personal view so realize everyone is different.
Posts.Title: Newbie - Big Breast Matching With Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies   Just a quick question this time, is there anyone out there who has had an mx and immediate reconstruction and how long were they in hospital?  My daughter is planning to get leave to be at home when I return from hospital so just wondered what to expect.  Doctor says 3-5 days is that anyone experience?
Posts.Title: Hospital Stay

Posts.Content: Hi Jules I have just come back from Dubai (7 hour flight) Had surgery in June and finished chemo in October. Had no ill effects at all. BTW Dubai is highly recommended for scarf wearing ladies, no one looks twice at you as a good percentage of ladies wear them anyway. Also no one walks about showing their cleavage and there are ladies around the pool fully clothed, even saw on lady swimming dressed in her abaya. Also its 28 degrees there now! I don't work for the UAE tourist board just love the place!
Posts.Title: Pigs might fly......

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I asked my Oncologist about this (first tax on Monday morning) and she said she had never heard of problems with nails or using black nail varnish in 20 years!  Still going to at least paint them a dark colour no harm done and possibly a lot to gain. Good luck to everyone. Rosie
Posts.Title: The wonders of evonail - day 13 no nail damage

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I finished my chemo 4 weeks ago and since then have been so tired all the time.  Worried now I am starting tamoxifen tomorrow and will feel even worse. Ever the optimist I have booked to go on lots of christmas meals and parties and at the moment can barely get off the sofa after 6pm.   Used to be the life and soul of every party, first on the dancefloor and last off, so am not looking forward to seeing everyone else having fun and me with no energy.  I have accepted the fact with no eyelashes or hair and nails that look like a relief map of a mountain range I will not look my best, but I want to feel a little bit human!
Posts.Title: How long does the fatigue last?

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I have been asked to take part in the Supremo trial for ladies with an intermediate risk of recurrance.  I have had a mx and undergoing chemo at the moment.  I was told if I don't take part in the trial I would'nt have radio (I have had an implant so there is a small risk of damage to that anyway). So now I am torn between helping out in a trial for future benefits and maybe my own as well if I get the radio treatment, or saying no as the radio is a time consuming and possibley pointless for me anyway. Has anyone else had to make this decision?
Posts.Title: Supremo Trial for Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Sue Thanks for you post, it really helped make my mind up to hear of someone else going through the same process.  I have decided not to go ahead with the trial and like you am already on one trial anyway, the poetic trial although I was one of the ones who didn't get the drugs to take. Good luck for the future.
Posts.Title: Supremo Trial for Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Saxxy Thanks for your reply.  Just to clear up a misunderstanding, they said in the normal run of things I wouldn't be offered radio anyway.  Its just a trail that I believe has been running a few years now that wants to see if there is any benefit to intermediate radio ladies.  They said I can agree to trial but still decline if I get picked for treatment.  Obviously the time involved and another 3 weeks of hardly getting any work done (I am working from home)  against a very small potential benefit, but of course if no one went on any trials we might not be in such a good position today.
Posts.Title: Supremo Trial for Radiotherapy
